items.text1: It is an open source Javascript library designed to create user interfaces to facilitate the development of single page applications.
items.text2: Hypertext Markup Language is the code used to structure and display a web page and its content.
items.text3: It is a vector graphics editor and prototyping tool, primarily web-based, with additional offline features enabled by desktop applications on macOS and Windows.
items.text4: It is an interpreted programming language, dialect of the ECMAScript standard. It is defined as object-oriented, prototype-based, imperative, weakly-typed, and dynamic.
items.text5: It is a computer language for working with data sets and the relationships between them.
items.text6: It is a free and open source programming language developed and maintained by Microsoft. It's a superset of JavaScript, essentially adding static types and class-based objects.
